text: and the motion is agreed to the very
fact that this new idea is coming
forward at the very same day that debate
on the bill is beginning I think is a
sign of just how weird and rush this
process has been the skinny repeal
appears to be a sort of last stitch
back-up plan this is definitely
McConnell giving it the old college try
he's worked really hard to try to write
a bill that he thought he could get 250
votes he's really struggled with that
and I think now he's potentially trying
again with something that is more modest
but potentially has the ability to
attract more votes we don't have any
legislative language yet on the skinny
repeals but it looks like what the plan
would do is it would repeal Obamacare as
individual mandate which is the
requirement that everyone have insurance
or pay a tax penalty it would remove
Obamacare's employer mandate which is a
rule that says that employers with more
than 50 workers need to provide
affordable insurance to their workers or
pay a fine and it would remove a tax
that the law created on medical devices
this bill is the most modest in terms of
the changes that it would make to
current law but I think that it would
have pretty substantial effects it would
probably result in somewhere in the
neighborhood of 15 million fewer
Americans having health insurance at the
end of the decade premiums increasing by
20 percent or more compared to what
would otherwise happen and to insurance
markets becoming very unstable and
uncompetitive in some parts of the
market so these are not trivial policy
changes this strategy seems very clearly
focused on trying to get to 50 votes in
the Senate and if you think about the
objections that various senators have
raised to the other proposals you can
see why this may be something that they
could agree on this would not make any
changes to the Medicaid program of note
there have been some concerns from more
conservative Republicans that the bill
puts too much money into the health care
system and doesn't really repeal
Obamacare it could be more easily sold
to those people as a partial but clean
repeal of Obamacare senators are not
going to have a lot of time to review
this provision and really think
through this very idea of skinny repeal
there is no legislative text there has
been no CBO score you would imagine that
those things will become public before a
vote but you know the clock is ticking
at this point and the Senate is under a
lot of pressure from the president to
try to produce some kind of results to
follow through and their promises to
repeal Obamacare
[Music]
